question: Your .gitignore file initially contains the single line *.log. To document a problem, you want to add a specific file named !error.log in your repository. Which is the recommended way to add and commit this file?
answers: Method A: Add a second line to .gitignore containing !error.log, then execute: git add error.log; git commit -m 'adding error.log'
options: Method A: Add a second line to .gitignore containing !error.log, then execute: git add error.log; git commit -m 'adding error.log'
Method B: Keep [.gitignore] as is and execute: git add -f error.log; git commit -m 'force adding error.log'
